intro: Tribulus macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually small and alternate, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Tribulus macranthus is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
